means: 用绳子拴住（牲畜）( tether的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: He tethered his horse to the fence.
If you try to keep him under control and tethered to your apron strings there will almost certainly be a row.
sentence.Network_cn: 如果你试图控制他，让他什么都听你的，十有八九你们会吵架。

sentence.Network_en: The orbiter - tethered to the fuel tank - was doomed from the first millisecond.
sentence.Network_cn: 与固体燃料箱拴在一起的航天飞机从最初的1毫秒起就注定会毁灭.

entry.tran: 无计可施;山穷水尽;走投无路
entry.def: If you say that you are at the end of your tether, you mean that you are so worried, tired, and unhappy because of your problems that you feel you cannot cope.

example.ex: She was jealous, humiliated, and emotionally at the end of her tether...
example.tran: 她既忌妒又感到屈辱，感情上已经到了崩溃的边缘。

example.ex: I've reached the end of my tether.

entry.def: A tether is a rope or chain which is used to tie an animal to a post or fence so that it can only move around within a small area.
If you tether an animal or object to something, you attach it there with a rope or chain so that it cannot move very far.

example.ex: The officer dismounted, tethering his horse to a tree.
example.tran: 军官下了马，把它拴到一棵树上。

means.word_mean: 1. confined or restricted with or as if with a rope or chain
